sections.heading: Maintenance
sections.text:
of Internet website by school districts containing information on available

examinations and assessments.

sections.heading: Selection
sections.text:
of assessment by State Board; eligibility to take assessment; permission of

board of trustees required under certain circumstances; regulations.

sections.heading: Disclosure
sections.text: of questions and answers prohibited; exceptions.

sections.heading: Administration
sections.text: of criterion-referenced examinations.

sections.heading: Council
sections.text:
to Establish Academic Standards for Public Schools required to review and evaluate

results of examinations; report of evaluation.

sections.heading: Adoption
sections.text:
of model to measure achievement of pupils on criterion-referenced examinations;

use of model to track progress of individual schools from year to year.

sections.heading: Definitions.
sections.text: Definitions.

sections.heading: Irregularity
sections.text: in testing administration� defined.

sections.heading: Irregularity
sections.text: in testing security� defined.

sections.heading: School
sections.text: official� defined.

sections.heading: Adoption
sections.text:
and enforcement of plan for test security by Department; contents of plan;

posting of plan on Internet.

sections.heading: Adoption
sections.text:
and enforcement of plan for test security by board of trustees; contents of

plan; annual submission of plan to State Board and Joint Interim Standing

Committee on Education; written notice concerning plan to educational

personnel, pupils and parents; definitions.

sections.heading: Violation
sections.text:
of state or district plan: Duty of Department to investigate; authority of

Department to issue subpoenas; enforcement of subpoena by court.

sections.heading: Violation
sections.text:
of district plan: Duty of board of trustees to investigate or refer to

Department; authority of board of trustees to issue subpoenas; enforcement of subpoena

by court.

sections.heading: Certain
sections.text:
schools required to provide for additional administration of examinations if

consecutive irregularities in testing administration occur; school district or

charter school required to pay costs of additional administration;

determination and notice by Department.

sections.heading: Plan
Establishment
sections.text:
of program of education and training regarding administration and security of

examinations and assessments; expanded program authorized; school districts and

charter schools required to ensure educational personnel receive program of

education and training.

sections.heading: Establishment
sections.text:
of procedures for uniform documentation and maintenance of irregularities in

testing administration and security; maintenance by Department of written

summary for each irregularity; annual report by Department required.

sections.heading: Definitions.
sections.text: Definitions.

sections.heading: Assessment�
sections.text: defined.

sections.heading: Examination�
sections.text: defined.

sections.heading: Irregularity
sections.text: in testing administration� defined.

sections.heading: Irregularity
sections.text: in testing security� defined.

sections.heading: Reprisal
sections.text: or retaliatory action� defined.

sections.heading: School
sections.text: official� defined.

sections.heading: Declaration
sections.text:
of policy concerning disclosure of irregularities in testing administration and

security.

sections.heading: School
sections.text:
official prohibited from using authority or influence to prevent disclosure of

information.

sections.heading: School
State
sections.text:
Board authorized to issue subpoenas during investigation or hearing concerning

reprisal or retaliatory action; enforcement of subpoena by court.

sections.heading: Use
sections.text:
of provisions for harassment prohibited; penalty for willful disclosure of

untruthful information.

sections.heading: Department
sections.text:
required to provide written summary of provisions to school districts and

charter schools; distribution of written summary to school officials.

sections.heading: Provisions
sections.text: do not abrogate or decrease effect of crimes or punishments.

sections.heading: State
sections.text:
Board required to prescribe criteria for standard high school diploma; college

and career readiness assessment; exception for certain pupils with

disabilities; criteria for receipt of adjusted diploma or alternative diploma;

prohibition to issue certificate of attendance.

sections.heading: Graduation
sections.text:
with college and career ready high school diploma; endorsements for such

diplomas; annual review of regulations establishing requirements; incentive

grants and reimbursements to public high schools and school districts for

pupils.

sections.heading: State
sections.text:
Board to select college and career readiness assessment for grade 11;

requirement of pupil to take assessment; results not used for receipt of

standard high school diploma; use of results to provide data and information

for pupil; adoption of regulations prescribing manner in which results must be

used to inform instruction to pupils in grade 12.

sections.heading: Department
sections.text:
required to develop and post on Internet website informational pamphlet

concerning college and career readiness assessment; posting of pamphlet and

distribution to pupils and parents.

sections.heading: Public
sections.text:
awareness campaign regarding types of diplomas and endorsements pupils may

receive.

sections.heading: Issuance
sections.text:
of standard high school diploma to certain veterans who left high school to

serve in Armed Forces.

sections.heading: Regulations
sections.text: relating to end-of-course finals. [Repealed.]

sections.heading: Limitation
sections.text: on administration; periodic review.

sections.heading: Review
sections.text: of examinations and assessments by Department.

sections.heading: Department
sections.text:
required to adopt regulations limiting time taken from instruction to conduct

and number of examinations or assessments; waiver.

sections.heading: Administration
sections.text:
of examinations to pupils who are English learners; State Board required to

prescribe modifications and accommodations; administration in language other

than English required under certain circumstances; assessment of proficiency in

English language.

sections.heading: Administration
sections.text:
of examinations to pupils with disabilities; modifications and accommodations

required for certain pupils; State Board required to prescribe alternate

examination.

sections.heading: Examinations
sections.text:
of National Assessment of Educational Progress; regulations requiring selected

schools to participate; report of results; report of discrepancies.

sections.heading: Enforcement
sections.text:
of contractual penalties or sanctions for failure to deliver results of

examinations on timely basis.
